items.content_html:
Changed milkweed.jgp to milkweed.jpg. Thank you.

Description

In the code example for 'Content with images must be labeled' the image had .jgp as a file suffix. I'm assuming it was meant to be .jpg

Motivation

Just removing a typo to remove an error.

Additional details

Not applicable.

Related issues and pull requests

Not applicable.
items.title: Typo in image file suffix within a code example

items.content_html:
Description

The documentation doesn't clarify that script elements in the parsed string are not being executed or ignored.

Motivation

Spend a lot of time / scratching my head why it is not working and only after reading the W3C spec it was clear

Additional details

https://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Parsing/#the-domparser-interface

See section 5.1

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: docs: Clarify parseFromString behaviour

items.content_html:
Associated BCD PR: mdn/browser-compat-data#19082

This is part of openwebdocs/project#152

I created all AudioProcessingEvent.* pages, including AudioProcessingEvent() even if not supported by Firefox (and strictly speaking outside the scope of the Q1 projects). As the interface is deprecated and, usually, the ctor is not called directly by the user code, I skipped writing an example for it. (It would have been cumbersome to test for next to no use).
items.title: Create AudioProcessingEvent.* docs

items.content_html:
Fixes #24957.

This PR:

  • fixes the type of event passed into the handler (ErrorEvent not UIEvent)
  • tries to be more explicit about the fact that the weirdness about cancelling the event only applies to the event handler property onerror.
items.title: Clarify Window.onerror behavior

items.content_html:
Motivation

This discussion describes the existing inconsistencies across the See also sections and the proposed set of guidelines to follow from here on.

Details of changes

  • In the Writing style guide:
  1. With the non-implementation of exposing H3 headings in the page TOC on the right, added a mini TOC in each of the three H2 sections "General writing guidelines", "Writing style", and "Page components".
  2. Upgraded "Shortened URLs (shortlinks)" from H4 to H3 and also edited the section a bit.
  3. Added the "See also section" section per the proposal in the discussion.
  4. Updated the "See also" section of the Writing style guide to comply with the new guidelines.
  • In the template files:
    Updated the "See also" section to refer to the guidelines in the writing style guide.

TO DO

  • Organize sub-sections in the writing style guide in alphabetical order.
  • Update "See also" sections in the pages used as examples in the discussion.
items.title: docs(meta): Add See also section guidelines to writing style guide

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is part of a multi-PR series that aims to document the WebGPU API. The interfaces documented in this PR are:

  • GPUCompilationInfo (done)
  • GPUCompilationMessage (done)
  • GPUDeviceLostInfo
  • GPUError
  • GPUInternalError
  • GPUOutOfMemoryError
  • GPUPipelineError
  • GPUQuerySet
  • GPUUncapturedErrorEvent
  • GPUValidationError

Note that the main PR for this series is #24202 â€” that one must be merged first, before this one! after that one is merged, main should be merged into this PR, and the documentation integrity must be checked (e.g. do all the links work) before merging.

You can see full details of the additions expected in the WebGPU docs in my research document.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: WebGPU PR #4 â€” Interfaces for handling errors and queries

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to format all of the documents using Prettier, and then enforce Prettier formatting for the files going forward. This PR formats the /mozilla folder, aside from the /mozilla/add-ons folder.

Cherry-picked from #24050 as that is blocked on the web extensions team.
items.title: Format /web/mozilla/[^add-ons] using Prettier

items.content_html: <datalist> elements are technically display: none by default. While it is true that their content may be used by other elements, such as an <input> via the list attribute, I do not believe this is sufficient for classifying <datalist> as an "inline" element.
items.title: Remove `<datalist>` from list of "inline" elements

items.title: transform-bâ€‹â€‹ox: added from w3c specification

items.content_html:
From FF111 if a fetch() request is redirected cross-origin, then a developer-added Authorization HTTP header will be removed from the request. The header is not stripped if the request is redirected to the same origin.

There isn't any particularly great place to record this information. What I have done is added it as a note to the option.headers value - I think that is the most likely place it will be seen. I've also added a release note.

Other docs work can be tracked in #22533
items.title: Ff111 fetch authorization cross origin

items.content_html:
Description

I propose saying the function will be called "RIGHT before the next repaint" instead of just "before the nest repaint".

Motivation

I believe it's important for the reader to understand that Window.requestAnimationFrame() will wait 1 / [browser fps] seconds before executing the callback, and that's why it must be used recursively.
items.title: Small change proposal

items.content_html:
Description

Safari now supports AVIF

Motivation

Lets readers know they can use AVIF in Safari now

Additional details

WebKit/WebKit#1717
items.title: Update Safari AVIF support

items.content_html:
Summary

  • The shorthand and longhand properties, scroll-timeline, scroll-timeline-name,
    scroll-timeline-axis, are still behind the layout.css.scroll-linked-animations.enabled preference in Fx111.
  • The order of name and axis is now fixed in the shorthand property via the linked bubzilla bug. This PR updates that part of content.
  • The PR also adds a section title for the example in the "Examples" section.

Supporting details

Doc issue tracker: #24396

Bug tracker: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1804573

Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/scroll-animations/#scroll-timeline-shorthand
items.title: docs(CSS): update scroll-timeline shorthand property

items.content_html:

Motivation

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: Add type to the background manifest key

items.content_html:
Description

I've gone ahead and added a page to document the SVG shape-subtract attribute.
In doing this I've largely following the example of the text-anchor page, trying to mirror it as closely as possible while reviewing the CONTRIBUTING.md and other relevant docs to ensure it meets the standards of MDN's docs.

The writeup and example portion of this have been taken straight from the specification's text and examples to ensure they are valid and accurate.

A quick warning though, no specification table or compatibility table exists yet for this item. So I will soon be making a companion PR to mdn/browser-compat-data to include this item as needed, to populate the {{Specifications}} and {{Compat}} sections.

(Also this is my first time contributing to an MDN repo, so please let me know if there was something I could've done better)

Motivation

Why: I've been using MDN's resources for years, and after a project I've been working on needed to rely on some of MDN's data I wished more docs had existed for certain items, so I decided to go ahead and do my part to make them exist.

How: Ideally this can better describe the capabilities of SVG and make attributes like this more well known for those that aren't reading through the specs themselves.

Additional details

  • Specification for Attribute
  • Example Docs Used
  • Specification for Example Attribute

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add Docs for SVG `shape-subtract` Attribute

items.content_html: This is the 3rd in the series. Revamped based on SC call feedback.
items.title: Filter function: brightness()
